Author: faisal husain
Review: This place is a hidden gem, rare to find a place where so much attention to detail has been spared by the proprietors, I kid you not, you can close your eyes and imagine yourself in the Yemen the smell of the expertly cooked lamb and the juicy chicken shish. Anyways I have tried almost everything on the menu and every dish is incredible, I will save wilting about the rice dishes, let's focus on the shish tawaooq or however it's spelt....never had chicken breast so juicy, not your dry interesting slightly soggy cardboard. Why am I bagging on about the chicken, because it's very rare to get it perfect like this, straight of the bbq, the flavour is out of this world. Don't get me started about the lamb, the ABSOLUTE BEST!!!!! Deeeeeeeeelicioussssss! The rice dishes are set apart from other Arab restaurants because they use premium pusa basmati rice. I honestly haven't had Yemeni malawa bread like this place, it's amazing all by itself.The best part is for premium ingredients the price is cheap to moderate, hopefully they won't put their prices up.Thank you for a wonderful experience everyone thro there.This place is a hidden gem, rare to find a place where so much attention to detail has been spared by the proprietors, I kid you not, you can close your eyes and imagine yourself in the Yemen the smell of the expertly cooked lamb and the ‚Ä¶More

Location: Jalan Penguasa A U1/53A, Kawasan Perindustrian Temasya, Shah Alam, Selangor

Location: Jalan Penguasa A U1/53A, Kawasan Perindustrian Temasya, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Aamir Kapasi
Review: The ambience and decor: This really stood out to me. Unlike most of the Arabic restaurants in Malaysia which are noisy, messy and, in all honesty, don't seem to be very hygienic, Hadramawt Kitchen is quiet, clean and I feel the management has taken great care in furnishing the restaurant with the comfort of customers in mind.The Food and drinks: 5 stars. My first thought upon eating the warak 'aynab was "Where have you been hiding all this time?! How come I had not heard about the place before?!" since I personally believe it is a hidden gem and found the food to be on the same level as the higher end places in the Middle East, but with affordable prices. The rice had just the right balance of being moist, wasn't too greasy and yet was ma shaa Allaah tabarak Allaah so fragrant and flavourful. Ditto on the chicken and, especially,  the mixed grill. Regardless of chicken or meat it was tender and packed some serious flavours. Loved the cocktail as well; sweet, thick and creamy with a nice balance of mango and strawberry (I think?). Definitely going back, God-willing.The ambience and decor: This really stood out to me. Unlike most of the Arabic restaurants in Malaysia which are noisy, messy and, in all honesty, don't seem to be very hygienic, Hadramawt Kitchen is quiet, clean and I feel the management ‚Ä¶More

Author: Ruqaiyah Mustafa
Review: Been here few times and I must say the taste is authentic Yemen! I personally love the mulawwah bread, eat with fahsa chicken, foul with cheese and hummus. The small mulawwah is enough for 4 people. Waiting time is reasonable ( less than 15 minutes). It‚Äôs two storey and you may choose to sit on the chairs or on the carpeted floor (traditional arab seating with pillows). The area is quite clean, air-conditioned. They offer various payment methods including grabpay, QRpay, cash and credit cards. Parking space are plenty but need parking coupon. The kitchen is closed during Friday prayers (1pm-2pm).Been here few times and I must say the taste is authentic Yemen! The lamb and chicken are to die for and they serve it with 3 different varieties of rice. The ambience is relaxed and not over-the-top. Author: Boon Chuan
Review: Hadramawt Kitchen located nearby the many automotive show room area in Glenmarie Shah Alam. The food is great value and taste good without burning a hole in your pocket. This is a comfortable place to dine in with families. You can choose whether to sit on normal table and chairs or Arabic seating style on low table. Order the roti Arab, appetizers and lamb rice which all good. Looks like I have found a perfect place for middle eastern food which is reasonably priced. Good food, good portion, friendly and helpful staff. My favourite were their Mullawah bread dipped with lamb sauce with tomato salsa sauce. Taste so good. Without knowing that Mullawah bread is quite huge, we ordered their lamb rice as well. The stewed lamb taste good and the meat was tender and delicious. The stewed version is better than their grilled lamb. Author: lmt6618 *
Review: Pleasant & homely balinese ambience. Lots of hand painted balinese history on walls. Choice of either humid or cool sitting. Polite & courteous staff who greeted us despite 30min to opening. None glass Open kitchen to watch your food being cooked. Seafood Nasi had a choice of fish or chicken or beef together with standard mini kunyit rice in small weaved basket, 2 medium grilled prawns, a stall of minced meat lemon grass, local mixed vege, soft succulent cuttlefish & a piece of medium size fried flavoured flour. Review: Ole-Ole Bali has always been one of my more favoured restaurants around. I do however want to note the drinks are extremely over sweetened (in particular the Lime Barley and Es Campur). The water had a really strange almost fishy taste to it (it had what looked to be Pandan in it) which was not very palatable.Ole-Ole Bali has always been one of my more favoured restaurants around. Author: Ray Chel Ng
Review: The best pan mee in Selangor for me. Soup is delicious, noodles are perfectly smooth and soft and the best part is the fried anchovies - they are the best!! Expect long queues and long wait during lunch time around 1130am-1pm
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Aurora
Review: Simple, good and affordable pan mee. Noodle is quite thin and smooth though, i prefer thick and chewy types. Soup is light and clear, perfect on a rainy day. No chili sauce here, only cili padi and soy sauce.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Nikoletta Frank
Review: Nice Pan Mee/Mee Hoon Kueh. The soup is light and tasty with crunchy anchovies. We added eggs to our noodles too. Queue, order and pay first before going in. You will be given a buzzer and food will be sent to you when it‚Äôs ready. Place is quite clean and not that hot. They only serve cili padi and no sambal/belacan. Author: Julie ‚ÄúJulieP‚Äù Pan
Review: 2pm and the waiting time is still so long. Waited at least 25 mins for a seat. A huge favorite among locals. Order and pay up front, and a token will be given to you with buzzer.No indication on the waiting time but they provide plastic stools to sit upon along the five foot way while you wait.We ordered the mee hoon kueh with egg. (Rm7.50 big bowl). Ikan bilis (anchovy) soup is clear and flavorful. Flat noodles are  smooth and al dente. Very little filling of veg and pork slices.2pm and the waiting time is still so long. Review: Klang best MeeHun Kuih, in fact, best in Malaysia. If not, probably best 3.The anchovies are crispy, the Kuih itself is super thin and silky. Soup base is clear, mild flavouring. Restaurants cleaniness is good.Visitor to Klang can come check out this Malaysia Cruisine in it best shape and flavours.Doubting my taste bud? Please come to judge by yourself. 5 stars Èù¢Á≤âÁ≥ïTakeaways option is amaze too. Author: Margaret Wong
Review: I grew up eating pan mee /mee hoon kuih every weekend in my grandma house. So first time here. Heard it‚Äôs good. This is a shop in Taman Berkeley Klang that serves mee hoon kuih and been operating for a long time.To me, think their version is a bit boring. Need to work on the ‚Äòliew‚Äô. Not wow but good for 1-2 times eating occasionally unless I‚Äôm sick then this is the food to go for. It‚Äôs a bowl of clear simple umami soup, easy to chew and soft noodle. Very little condiments. Pan mee or flat noodle, is made very soft and thin. Hand teared but since it‚Äôs machine knead, don‚Äôt get the chewiness like those done traditional way, by hand.  We get in line to order, make payment and get a queue no either dine in or take away. And wait for your food to be prepared and served.I grew up eating pan mee /mee hoon kuih every weekend in my grandma house. So first time here. Heard it‚Äôs good. This is a shop in Taman Berkeley Klang that serves mee hoon kuih and been operating for a long time. ‚Ä¶More

Author: Li Yuen
Review: Smooth pan mee with tasty anchovy broth! The absolute best comfort food on a rainy day‚Ä¶ But you may need to queue, we waited for abt 30 minutes.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Rob & Steph
Review: Popular place for pan mee. Order and pay first, then will get a table when it comes available.  Pan mee taste is ok.  Hand-pulled tear noodles are good but some pieces were a bit chewy.  Add an egg and the broth was very tasty.  Fairly clean environment.  Prices are very reasonable.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Tiny House jtrch29 Richmondsolutions
Review: Long queue on a sunday aftnoon. Not as good as before. Quality drop for the soup. The staffs should have asked the customers if they want pig's liver in their soup noodle. I dont consume any animals organs so I was a bit dissapointed. Due to the distance, I dont think I will go again in the near future.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Evon Lau
Review: Loved the soup, and its thin mee hoon kueh. Price is really reasonable. But expect long wait. You can even tapao non cook noodles to take home and cook at your convenience
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Presentation is average. Ikan bilis is about 7-8pcs. Pork with liver is about 3pcs each.No small onions at all! üò®You need to order fried small onions üå∞ separately if want to eat.Overall, mee hoon kueh standard dropped, portion is little for small. Review: You can get a very nice bowl of mee fun kuey here. But is a bit crowded for MCO protocols, especially on a Saturday afternoon. Worth going, if you like this noodle.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Elizabeth Yow
Review: The Pan Mee noodle is very smooth, the soup is tasty and pork is tender. Price is considered cheap but not much of "liu" ingredients. The Nasi Lemak here is good. This restaurant is suitable for 7 years old and above.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Ming Jin
Review: The mee hoon kuih is one of thinnest I ate across several states. But the soup is really so so.. it's healthy but tasty no
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Hugo Kew
Review: Worth the long waited mihun kuih. Delicious soup and great texture of the mihun kuih. Plus, it's not very expensive for a large bowl, if were to compare to others
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Joshua Foo
Review: Superb, smooth, silky and slurppy noodles. That's the bomb. So so good. Soup is heartwarming too. Homemade style at its finest.Need to wait for a while for the food, even though not full house.Superb, smooth, silky and slurppy noodles. That's the bomb. So so good. Soup is heartwarming too. Homemade style at its finest. ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: CHIN CHEE KOO
Review: Nice soup, not warm inside the shop. Good queue system..wait abt 15min to 20 min
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Sam Foo
Review: Smooth pan mee with soup base & chilly should improve instead of chilly pati with soy sauce only
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Jason Yong
Review: The most delicious and smoothest Pan Mee in Klang. It's always pack so be prepared to wait for food and table sharing is a norm here. One of the highly recommended food to eat while you're in Klang.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Min Huei Chai
Review: Soft and pillowy Pan Mee served in more of a sweet neutral broth rather than the usual more savoury and umami types. Also pieces of pork slices and liver, and and optional egg adds body to the meal. Overall decent and cheap.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: f e l i c i a c
Review: Less crowded after COVID-19. They take your order first before you are seated. Their standard noodles is pitted by hand and serves with soup. I doubt the parking still the concern coming here. Taste still the same and smaller portions.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Edwin Cheah
Review: This is one of the top rating food in Klang, we have been eating here for past 15yrs, is their family business and now success by their daughter and son, it is still one of the best if you think of tradisional taste of mee hoon kuih (pan mee). Highly recommended and ofcourse ada babi! üê∑
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Swee Fong Wong
Review: I never really like mee hoon kuih but really love it from this shop. Would be  better if u buy home to cook yourself n add in extra minced pork, bursting meatballs n sawi!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Chek Yan Ching
Review: Cheap and taste not bad, but i don't think it worth the wait. The taste is just ok and not very special, and the taste level is worst compared to last time. The proportion is quite less for me even I ordered for extra large.

Author: Ranie Ng

Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: KY ‚ÄúKaryne‚Äù Loh

Author: Blaise
Review: Best comfort food especially on a rainy day. You have to place your order and pay first at the entrance then wait in line for your turn to be seated. Broth is flavourful. The hand torn noodles (mee hoon kueh) are silky smooth. You can also choose other types of noodles. Price is very reasonable at only RM5.50 for a small bowl and RM6.00 for a large bowl. You definitely should add on an egg for an additional RM1.Best comfort food especially on a rainy day. Author: Nic Wang
Review: Honestly the food is not that great for me. Just another normal Mee Hoon Kuih. Price is cheap. I wont travel from KL just for this. No queue around 11.15am.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: min2402

Author: Ken Teh
Review: The mee hoon kuey is average, nothing mind blowing..Rm6 for a bowl with additional egg is quite a good deal..Nothing much special..
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Cory Langgie

The scenario was just a small matter, I did not wanted to add the pork liver to the soup, and only wanted pork meat. However, I did not know that their pork & liver refer to the meat and the liver separately. So upon order, I should have said only "liver" instead of "pork liver".In the end the noodle served with plain noddles without any meats. Then I tried to ask them, why is it like this in a nice way and the boss started to argue with me in a very impolite way and keep pushing it to my responsibilities that it's my fault that I ordered wrongly. Author: Kent Lim
Review: Bought the frozen marinated chicken and pork chop from this place.... Good taste and easy to prepare. Give it a try today....
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Review: If you are prepared and willing for a long wait, which will make you more hungry and make it tastiest.

Author: Wai Yip Chan
Review: The crowd is not as bad as before and queuing time is much shorter.

Review: Places where served reasonable price of mee hoon kueh. Nice place, but need to queue during peak hour like lunch or dinner time, especially weekend
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Review: Always packed place for hand torn pan mee. Silky smooth. Expect some waiting time as every order is made fresh. Can be quite stuffy in the restaurant.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: christine wong
Review: Their soup is clear n I like their pan mee dough. I usually buy the uncooked ones so that I can cook at homeThey are quite calculative n not so generous esp when I say I dont want the intestines,  they dont replace it with pork slices üò©üò©

Author: Lee Boon Hai
Review: Food nice but environment very not comfortable. Crowded and very hot because of the ventilation

Author: Rachel W
Review: So so. Just a pork Noodle soup. Yes indeed is very cheap. Nothing special.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: sam chai
Review: best transitional pan mee, taste good and price is cheap.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Anthony F
Review: I would rate it the number 1 place for a traditional bowl of Mee Hoon Kuih. If you do not want to wait 30-60 mins for your bowl, head there between 8-9am on weekdays. Price is very reasonable and taste explains the crowd they attract.

Author: M Y Woo
Review: If you come during lunch hour, expect to wait for 20 minutes for your food after ordering.

Author: Hanskiran SJ
Review: The best Mee Hoon Kuih you will ever try in Selangor.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Cassey
Review: Best Pan Meeeee ever!! If you love hot slurpy hand torn pan meeee this is the place! Best broth and just goes down so well   .
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Melvin Lim
Review: Discovered this place while passing by and saw a long queue outside the shop. Returned a few weeks later and realize there wasn't a queue before their lunch time peak hr. Decent mee hoon kuih, smooth, tasty and affordable. But I don't think I would wait more than 20 mins for a seat if I had to. Great comfort food

Author: Louise Aw
Review: Thin mee hoon kuih and nice soup. Worth for the queue.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Roland Tan

Author: dixon ong

Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

The restaurant has been passed down for one or two generations as of now, and quality is still fairly good. It's family friendly, and once you've eaten their food, you'd find that similar food from other places are bland.

Author: Victor Liew

Author: Nicole Law
Review: Broth is very flavorful, thinly sliced mee hun keuh is cooked to perfection
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Cheryll Jeanne (ZomgACrayon)
Review: Their Mee hoon kueh is silky smooth due to their dough recipe and is handmade and pulled to perfection. It's thin and glides so it makes eating it so damn addictive and enjoyable. Their staff are long serving and very professional as well as friendly. Love eating here and it's one of the only restaurants I would wait for more than half an hour to get a seat at.Their Mee hoon kueh is silky smooth due to their dough recipe and is handmade and pulled to perfection. Author: Brian J S
Review: Delicious. Top value for money. The noodles, broth and ingredients are super. The barley drink is infused with pandan leaves and was super. A large bowl with everything in it including an egg cost rm6.20. A must try.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Merdroid Woods
Review: An established place for a local favourite. Excellent service by ever present and attentive staff. Consistently tasty food prepared when you order and serves piping hot.  Come early to avoid long waits for seats and food during peak periods.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Derek Saw
Review: It's one of the better meehoonkuih in klang valley. The soup is nice, dun think they added any msg as u won't feel thirsty after the meal. Author: JA Lee
Review: Nice Mee Hoon Kuih. Soft and smooth, very special. Soup is just nice. Others MHK normally hard and not smooth. A lot of people, so be prepared to wait..... long wait.....still waiting....Price is alright. Shop is clean also.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: HY
Review: Crazily super crowded if you are coming during the lunch time. Few chinese staff are kinda rude and disrespectful if you do not know the rules there, especially for newcomers. First they don't allow customer straight walk-in to be seated, and you will need to make the order, else you will be told in a way of actsy (very lansi) attitude and received cold stare obnoxiously by the staff. Because they are famous in Klang, they don't see customers as valuable assets attribute to their business.Personally I think they are overrated based on the foods, their Mee Hoon Kuih is just an normal pan mee as outside, taste so-so and just okay. Review: 20 over years same tasted you're not able to get the price in this area

Author: SUSAN Chin
Review: Nice food not only fresh but tasty.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Timothy Chan
Review: One of the best Mee Hoon Kuih aka Pan Mee place in Selangor. The soup is really good. The whole combo is very harmonious. Terror yummy.

Author: yc Goh
Review: Not the same as a couple years ago. Renovated and considerably clean now. Though at times still need to wait for seat, situation is better now probably the number of tables has increased and waiting time for food has also improved. Place for decent Mee Hoon Kuay.

Author: Pet
Review: Good value for the Mee Hoon  kuih. Long wait and poor service. Still crowded most of the time.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Review: It was super crowded when I visited, but after tasting the good it totally made sense. I'm happy enduring the wait for the food. But maybe next time I'll order the XL bowl so I don't have to order twice hahahaha
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Tiang Seng LEE
Review: Busy time usually need to wait 30-45 mins
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Dhennver Ng
Review: The dough is chewy smooth and the soup is delicious.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: K C
Review: Fish ball mee hoon soup . üòãüòãüòã
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Ignatius Ong
Review: Best mee hun kueh ever in this part of Malaysia. Soup base is clear and flavourful as well as great tenderised pork meat. The dough is smooth and the right chewy texture. Chilli padi complement the bowl really well. Great for weekend morning breakfast. Will always come back.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Mike Chai
Review: Really love the pan mee because the soup base was really nice, should order add on fried shallot and fried anchovy. yum yum
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Alice Ong
Review: The best Mee Hun Kueh nationwide. Soup base is delicious and sweet whilst the dough is torn and cooked to perfection with a little bit of el dente bite to it. Tender pork strips and if complimented with their chili padi, this is pure comfort food for any Asians.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Milky Mu
Review: We reached here at 12.30pm, so lucky to hv a table as there were long q after this. 30min wait for our food to be served. Authentic village style mee huen kuih or some call pan mee. Just like how mom did it those old days.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: LP Lee
Review: Come early if you are here during weekend. Super long wait! But worth the wait. This dish better know as Pan Mee to some....Mee Hoon Kuih. Every bowl is cook individually hence the long queue and long wait.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Damien W
Review: The food is very good. However, do expect a long wait before you get your food.Pro tip, the process here is to order your food first and let them allocate you a table. You may be required to share a table.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Shi Song (Êùæ)
Review: My go to place in Klang, the crowd can be overwhelming at times and sharing table is a must if you wanna dine during peak hours.Well worth the wait as the food is GREAT, also they are price fairly.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Cheryl Yeung
Review: The mee hun kueh is one of the nicer ones I've tasted. But the wait is quite long, sometimes up yo an hour during lunch time. Don't like that the mea is coated with corn starch and the choi Sam. Mhk in taman melawis is slightly better cos the soup is more flavourful
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Alvin Klpj
Review: Most overrated pan mee..nothing special. Soup is tasteless..only very salty. Hate it when the soup is so not sincere. Very strong fried onion taste in its soup. Ikan bilis tasteless. Some more need to wait min 1 hour in its very very hot and stuffy shop. Don‚Äôt waste your time here!

Author: Jonathan Chew
Review: To me it was overrated if you need an hour waiting time. Nothing extraordinary, just a nice mee hun kueh. The space is very small and it's very hot inside due to the heat from the cooking area. Unless you have plenty of time and don't mind the heat, this place is a go to for a good mee hun kueh.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Mimi Lim
Review: Food is fairly good. However they have very rude staff, suggest that if you dont mind to taste a good bowl of noodle, face a bunch of rude and unfriendly ladies.... you can try it out!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Hui Lan Son
Review: Classic Mee Hoon Kuih! Mee Hoon Kuih is thin , soup is delicious and pork is fresh.Serving is fast. Must try in Klang!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Charles W
Review: One if the best "Pan Mee" in Klang. Excellent ikan bilis soup base. Prepare for long wait if you're there around lunch hour. Every bowl is cooked individually to perfection which requires time. Worth waiting if you're a fan if " Pan Mee".
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Kelvin Khoo
Review: A good restaurant in Taman Berkeley, Klang. You have to be patient, tho, as the wait can be as long as half an hour. But the texture of the noodles is fantastic. Smooth as silk.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Siegfried Shaun Dela Pena Tan
Review: Generally, I'm not much of a "pan mee" fan, but this mee hoon kuih in Klang is one of a kind. The soup flavour is just right and the texture of the "noodle" is perfect. Waiting time for food to be served is around 30 mins, on average.. but personally, the wait is worthwhile.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Edd C
Review: This is the best mee hun kuey I have tasted so far. Dont bother trying others like the famous one in Subang/ PJ Hock Tai/ Cheras/ Sri Kembangan. Totally waste of time.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Peter Toh
Review: Nice traditional meehoon ker soup base. Overall is good but just need to wait due to many ppl. during lunch. After 6.30pm ... jeng.. jeng.. jeng.... anyone knew why???
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Simon SS Lau
Review: Probably the most sought after Mee hoon kuih in Klang in an upgraded old shoplot. It has an opened kitchen with few dedicated kitchen hands to hand kneaded the fresh dough into thin bite sizes and cooked Al dente. The broth is savoury and the ikan bilis deep fried to crunchy perfection. Prices is inexpensive but parking is an headache.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Ferdaus Ahmad Zaki
Review: Just another plain old traditional mee hoon kueh. If you can't wait long enough, try not to come during peak lunch or dinner hours. When less customers, you'll find the service is much better. Standard price in Klang town, so relatively cheap if compared to prices of the same bowl in Kuala Lumpur.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Mercidanke
Review: Good service best mee hoon kuih in klang worth to having meal in here
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Malcolm Len
Review: One of my favourite mee hoon kuih in Klang, try to avoid lunch hour because you might not have a place to sit and have to wait for a while just to get a sit. It's that good. Anyways the price is affordable!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: MathPhys
Review: This restaurant specialty is the mee hoon kueh, which has quite a similar textual as pan mee. Usually there is a long queue. Anyway, getting a seat is quite fast, but the waiting time for your food might be quite long. Be patient if you want to get a tasty mee hoon kueh.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Nicklaus T
Review: Still one of the best mee hoon kui in Klang town. Usually quite busy during peak hours and the waiting time can be quite long. Best to come before 12 in the afternoon or you can share tables with other people. Will always go for 'extra large' and a cup of ginseng chrysanthemum tea drink.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Jan wee Tan
Review: great local delicacies of handmade noodles  but you need to be patient as waiting for food is easily between 30-45 minutes, not including getting a table before taking up orders.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Sook Yee See
Review: Love the hand torn noodles and the clarity of the soup. Get there early to snap for a table. And make sure you're not rushing to anywhere because it might take a long time for your food to arrive.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Sonny Tang
Review: One of the best mee hoon kueh places in town. A little stuffy inside and the queue can be quite long. A tip for you, just order at the front where they cook, and they will find a place for you to sit.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Lim Boon Tiong
Review: Food still good..but the soup not as good as 10-20 years ago.. Now is second generation take over..overall still good..will come back againüòÄ
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Wei Seng Heng
Review: Many people queuing up for food, the best thing is that they will help you find the place to sit. U don‚Äôt need to seek the seat yourself, all you need to do is queue and wait for food.The drinks is not nice, too diluted.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Simon Tan Sze Mung
Review: The best MHK period !Soup is pure bone and bilis ( no msg aftertaste ) , the texture of the flour kuih is the best you can ever achieved and it's handmade   ,so consistent and thin , you can't even make it better using a roller !Cheap price !Why even 4 star , this is 5 star la !Any better MHK , you tell me I go try but I doubt it !Deserve a hawker Michelin star this one !The best MHK period !Soup is pure bone and bilis ( no msg aftertaste ) , the texture of the flour kuih is the best you can ever achieved and it's handmade   ,so consistent and thin ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Hanxue Lee
Review: If you fancy traditional home cooked mee hoon kuih, this is the place to be. Each bowl of mee hoon kuih is cooked only upon order. Instead of a big pot of soup with machine made kuih, there are individual pots and the hand pinched kuih is smooth and thin. The combination of meat, vegetables, fried onion and fried ikan bilis makes every mouthful scrumptious.Be prepared for a long wait time though, outside of meal hours the wait can be 30 minutes or more. During lunch time, one can easily wait for an hour or more.If you fancy traditional home cooked mee hoon kuih, this is the place to be. Each bowl of mee hoon kuih is cooked only upon order. Instead of a big pot of soup with machine made kuih, there are individual pots and the hand pinched kuih is ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Lyn
Review: Comfort food at its best. Perfect breakfast place for anyone who likes a bowl of warm soup in the morning.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Steven Tan
Review: Chose the fine noodle rather than the the 'pulled dough'. Soup was savory and tasty. Go early but do expect a crowd ya. Will definitely be going back there.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Alvin H
Review: The MHK is great! But the soup is a huge let down. Still prefer the traditional soup using baby spinach leaves. The vege taste too overpowering in the soup. What a let down.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Sue Chew Yap
Review: Popular shop for mee hoon kuih (or min fan kuih) where the taste (soup) is just right and  prices are also very reasonable. That is why it is usually very crowded, so be prepared to wait or come during off-peak period.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Poh lin
Review: It was OK.....the noodles were soft. the soup was good (not mind blowing). didn't like the chilli padi dip and didn't like the stainless steel spoon. How do you drink hot soup with a hot spoon??
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Kh Chua
Review: This is definitely a Bench Mark for Mee Hun Kuih. Get ready to wait especially on werkend because it is always full. Restaurant is clean,service pretty fast but restaurant can be a bit hot.The broth is clear,sweet and delicious,pork is still succulent and tender,ikan billis is crispy.The combination is done perfectly.Will be back.This is definitely a Bench Mark for Mee Hun Kuih. Get ready to wait especially on werkend because it is always full. Restaurant is clean,service pretty fast but restaurant can be a bit hot. ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Chong Eu Meng
Review: A Childhood favourite and still is one of the definite go-to place for Mee Hoon Kiuh. The quality of the food there is still good despite it is still kept at a relatively reasonable price.

Author: Ling Shi Cai
Review: The thinnest mee hoon kuih every have and is super nice.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Fuey Tat Tai
Review: no doubt it's delicious. the place is super crowded most of the time, not so during 3-5pm. if u see no crowd at 7-8pm... don't be happy, because it's sold out.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Terrence Ho
Review: Soup is fresh and sweet, pork meat and pork organ cook medium well, no over cook, can ask for add fried pork lard, u will no regret to add it. Price is consider cheaper.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: KN C
Review: Highly recommended place for silky things and smooth noodle. Good value for money. A  good choiced mee hoon kuih outlet.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: John Lee
Review: One of my favorites in Klang. Only thing is you may have to wait up to 45mins for a bowl of meehoonkuih during peak hour!

Author: Lucas Leong
Review: One of the best mee hoon kuih I've tasted. Texture was smooth and soft yet chewy. Reasonable pricing. Place was hygienic.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Chun Chet Gan
Review: To get a famous mee hoon kuih in Klang.There are a few offering the same in Klang town but this is catering for foreign travellers as well as tourists.Small bowl it is, however the taste is quite similar to homemade approach of the past ages.To get a famous mee hoon kuih in Klang.There are a few offering the same in Klang town but this is catering for foreign ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Andrew Shine
Review: Everything is good and the mee hoon kuih is soft and silk, unlike others thick and harsh.Down side is that the environment is very hot, recommended to sit outside rather sitting insideEverything is good and the mee hoon kuih is soft and silk, unlike others thick and harsh. ‚Ä¶More
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: John Teoh
Review: Benchmark for Mee Hoon Kuih as far as I'm concerned. Paper thin hand peeled flour which is boiled until it has an al dente texture slightly firmer than wonton skin blanched in a soup concoction that has been a secret handed down from father to son. Leave it in the soup too long and it starts to stick together and revert back to its original flour state.  Pair that with their very finely shredded cincau and soya bean milk and you know what having this back in your childhood days in the kitchen of your kampung house was like.Benchmark for Mee Hoon Kuih as far as I'm concerned. Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Law Hui Chung
Review: This is my first visit to this shop. Highly recommended. Delicious food for young and old. Clean environment and staffs are friendly. Crowded with customers. Must try!!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Edwin Tan
Review: Very lovely Chinese traditional food! Expect crowd all time starting from 10AM to 4PM, getting your food serve will take another 30-45 minutes but truly worth the wait!
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Goh c. teak
Review: Popular restaurant in Berkeley garden. Be prepared to queue during lunch hours. Parking is a problem during peak hours. The Mee Hoon Kuih is tasty and good.

Author: Ywen C
Review: A restaurant that i will always go for Mee Hoon Kuih. Flat and thin mee hoon kuih and rich taste broth are seducing me everytime when i crave for noodles. They serves "noodles" only before 9am so please take note, no mee hoon kuih available at that time.

Author: Jonathan Ng
Review: Cheap, taste for me is mediocre.
Location: Leboh Bangau, Taman Berkeley, Klang, Selangor

Author: Jim Koay
Review: Really good noodles.On Saturday the crowd is ok, but on Sunday do come before 10 to prevent waiting up to 30-45 minutes

Author: Jason Hiang

Author: Kien Chua

Author: Kyong Goh

Author: J P

Author: Aaron Tan
Review: Can never go wrong , best Mee hun kueh in town

Author: MashDT

Author: Yi Ching Chia

Author: Donnie Ng

Author: ttsiong
Review: üòã..üëç

Author: Adeline Tan

Author: Chibi Wen

Author: Richard Tan
Review: The kueh smoothness and tangyness are unique, second to none in KL. Parking and the queuing time  can be a real deterrent especially when u r hungry.

Author: Pohly T
Review: All ingredients are well prepared ,went there before rush hour, enjoy my bowl of mee hoon kuih. Reasonable price, good flavor.

Author: Charlene Soon
Review: Grew up eating this and love it. Lunch time and dinner times are usually packed throughout the week. Usual waiting time is a minimum of 30 minutes to an hour.

Author: Eddie Lo
Review: One of the best food in klang

Author: Andrew Wong

Author: Chee Wayne Lee

Author: A K
Review: One of the best "meehoon kueh" in Klang. But it's bit too long on the waiting time. Minimum 45 minutes.

Author: Jing Chan
Review: Waited an hour , suggest to go early to avoid huge crowd. Personally think it is not up to its hype, however, taste is not bad

Author: Lim Marc
Review: The best mee hoon kuih i ever had

Author: Eddie Lee
Review: Best mee hoon kuey in Klang. It never failed to satisfy and expect waiting or sharing table with other patrons. My favorite is what they called QQ mee..

Author: Jye Chyi Lim

Author: Kwong Thong Goh
Review: I was initially quite apprehensive when I brought my family and stepped into the restaurant. We were the only patrons then (and also when we left).The menu was also quite limited (eventually was advised this was due to lack to staff), and many of the items reviewed earlier were no longer on the menu.So we ended up ordering a burger (Hawaiian) set, french fries, Aglio Olio with Teriyaki Chicken, Spaghetti Pomodoro and another pasta with 3 cheeses.My initial trepidation dissipated when the orders were served. The quality of the food was excellent, and the flavours very well balanced. We especially like the teriyaki chicken (very tender) and the spaghetti pomodoro (my missus said it reminded her of a lovely restaurant in Italy). The french fries was far better than those served at fast food outlets and one of the better ones I have had in a while.Portions are not particularly big so if you have a big appetite a second order is likely necessary. Prices are average (a bit high from a volume perspective, but duly compensated by the taste and quality).You will have to wait a bit for the food to be served as every item is supposedly prepared from scratch (it took about 20 minutes for the food to arrive) but for me it was worth the wait.A return visit is very likely for me.I was initially quite apprehensive when I brought my family and stepped into the restaurant. That beef burger was juicy and oh so delicious. If you‚Äôre vegetarian or going for a meat-free day, try the falafel burger. It‚Äôs very well dressed with herbs that leaves you wanting more. Author: Nava K
Review: Set lunch indeed is the valid reason why I popped by with my Indian friend who is French food fancy frilly.  Cucumber juice we started off is something different. I can assure you it‚Äôs not the cucumber juice you make in your house. This one is special. Elevated with other ingredients as well for daintily punching waking you up. Nice and soothing. Sipping in, simultaneously we nibbled the bread. Must be French bread right? Can't be Indian bread in  French restaurant?Next, we tackled the Mushroom Soup and Salad. My-my! Unlike the bluffology con job canned mushroom soup, conning by the way takes place in high eat eateries too, this Mushroom Soup I strongly believe is made in La Belle Saison‚Äôs kitchen. I can vouch. Up notch delicious. Cute tiny croutons, herbs and a drizzle of olive oil atop thick, creamy and full of flavours Mushroom Soup.Equally appetizing was the Potato Mango Salad. I particularly love its tangy sweet vinaigrette, tossed alongside soft digestible potato,mango, tomato, salad leaves and croutons. So lovable. Both of these dishes polished up till super clean. Caesar Chicken Wrap, not the Caesar in "Return Of The Planet Of The Apes" though, teamed alongside Mashed Potato and Potato Salad was a winner for my friend. Neatly tucked with chicken pieces, veggies and some sort of creamy dressing. Taste can't be faulted, but sorry peeps, I am not a wrap person. No way. Please don‚Äô bring any wrap close to me. I will hate you. The accompanied Mashed Potato and Potato Salad I bet will always be loved by anyone?For me, the moment of truth was Oven Baked Chicken. Utterly fab. No smell, moist and super tender meat tucked beneath absolutely crispy skin. Yum! Plain tastes alright yet remarkable. I still can‚Äôt get over and done with it. Crispy Potato Skin and Garlic Mash were quite rocking as well. My friend couldn‚Äôt agree more.We then realise that dessert is not included in set lunch. Why not? I‚Äôm sure a tiny serving of French sweetness can be thrown in? French cuisine without dessert is definitely not complete. Thus, we flipped the menu to call for Crepe Banana Chocolate. What can I say? Disappointingly pin drop silence. The only food loser amongst everything we had tucked into so far. Something didn‚Äôt go right. Bottom line, we didn‚Äôt like crepe with banana slices and chocolate. What a waste to our money.Having said that, conclusively, set lunch in La Bella Saison is really worth it. And to those of you who keep harping that La Belle Saison is a hidden gem, for god sake, stop it. Sounds really corny. La Bella Saison is not hidden. Waze up and it will land in front of La Belle Saison where parking is friendly and if you bump into the owner, tell him Nava said hi.Set lunch indeed is the valid reason why I popped by with my Indian friend who is French food fancy frilly.  Cucumber juice we started off is something different. I can assure you it‚Äôs not the cucumber juice you make in your house. This one ‚Ä¶More
Location: 13-G, Jalan Sungai Burung W 32/W, Bukit Rimau, Shah Alam, Selangor

The pasta was so claggy that I was quite done with it by the third mouthful. The dish in itself looked pretty sad, and the only ingredient to accompany the pasta was some chicken bits. I was quite famished when I arrived at the restaurant which was why I‚Äôd decided that ordering from the set lunch would be the quickest option. Even the appetizer of garden salad was drowning in the tardy orange vinaigrette. The only saving grace from my set was the drink of the day which was a cucumber lime drink. As my date and I were the last to leave the restaurant before they close for the afternoon, the restaurant‚Äôs staff was already occupying the back tables and looked unwelcoming. I was turned off to say the least. I‚Äôm not sure I will be back to give this restaurant a second chance. Author: Chan Mei Theng

The lamb and rice taste just right with the right amount of spices. Not to forget, the lamb is really tender. The shish tawook is a little bit dry so not really to my liking. Author: Suhaimi Ramli
Review: This place was recommended by one of my friend when i text him "bro, what is a nice place here in shah alam to get arabic cuisine?"1st time getting here, and im impressed with the building. Going inside, lots of people but they also got many tables for you to seat.Ordered Lamb Mandy, Chicken Kebab and Cheese Kunafa that night.Lamb Mandy : very big portion. Looks like the portion was for 3 person. Haha. The lambs were juicy and tender. I love it! The rice a bit dry, but it comes with soup and sambal.Chicken Kebab : nice to eat. Very soft and tender, the taste was good. But i was unable to finish it due to the Mandy's portion was so huge.Cheese Kunafa : im not into kunafa usually. But this is my wife's review. The Kunafa was nice, but a bit milky, taste like a sweetener. But she love the cheese all over the Kunafa.A bit bad review: the staff was not so friendly. Need to improve on this. I asked the staff to pack my lemon juice, as i need to rush for another place. One of the staff took my juice and bring it somewhere. After 5 minutes, i still didnt get my juice back. I go to the kitchen and ask one of the staff, but the staff keep on pushing me to go to another counter by saying "air order sana" and repeat it a few times eventhough i still not finish my talking.Otherwise, the foods all good. The place was nice to bring family. Recommended üôåThis place was recommended by one of my friend when i text him "bro, what is a nice place here in shah alam to get arabic cuisine?" ‚Ä¶More
Location: 2, Jalan Platinum G 7/G, Seksyen 7, Shah Alam, Selangor

Of course, if you're not used to middle eastern food, you'd might need some time adapting, but they are delicious in their own way. I think this restaurant is Yemeni.. this is important because the way they cook a dish differs in each country.Prayer space is available, it's a makeshift space, so if you're not comfortable with that, there's a mosque nearby.Our food came a bit slow because of the crowd, the waiter missed two dishes so we had to wait a little bit longer, but to me it's fine.Go on and give the place a try!If you want to 'fefeeling' having dinner in a castle, this would be just the right place. We had 2 sets of nasi arab with lamb, mango juice & mint lime. Lamb mendi was nice, lamb kabsa was too much fat. Mango juice was yummy but mint lime was too sour. Total bill was RM81.05 for 2 pax. Overall, I think the place was very noisy. Our drinks arrived first followed by the rice. They'd forgotten our sides; had to call the waiter & waited until the rice is cold before the sides were brought to our table. Soup spilled due to the waiter's rough handling. We requested for an extra bowl of soup but it never arrived. The workers cleaning the tables were rough. Will I come back here? Author: timothy lim
Review: Good food, nice ambiance, friendly service.... with a touch of refinement, and a subtle hint of pedigree. Has a convenient lounge for drinks which doubles as an area for cocktail chatter before dinner.Eventhough Senja did have a slight air of formal-ness about it, it did not come across as being too uppity. An oxymoron of sort but i do not have a better description. Perhaps the closest would be to describe it as being unpretentiously classy.An awesome place to host an event, be it a private party or entertaing a group of business partners. I just attended a friends 50th Birthday. The setting and organisation was impeccable!My only gripe is the name..... Senja give the impression of local dishes and Malay specialities, much like the Serai or Santai restaurants..... however Senja excels in authentic Italian cuisine. Here you will get fresh pastas and proper Italian pizzas. We had succulent roast beef loin, expertly done pan seared seabass, mushroom soup and not forgetting the *to die for" Tiramisu & Pana Cotta for  dessert.Good food, nice ambiance, friendly service.... with a touch of refinement, and a subtle hint of pedigree. Has a convenient lounge for drinks which doubles as an area for cocktail chatter before dinner. ‚Ä¶More
Restaurant: Senja Restaurant @ The Saujana Hotel Kuala Lumpur
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Subang, SAAS Resort, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: jenny foo
Review: Marvellous dim sum at fine dining Chinese restaurant. The dim sum was delicious and generous portion. One of the best dim sum in town and it's halal or Muslim friendly. The restaurant is cozy and comfortable. Friendly customer service.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: KK Liew
Review: Very nice food, the CNY menu pricing is very reasonable. With this kind of food and this kind of price. The service and environment is very good. And it's very good place to bring small children, because it is not crowded. It's next to a lake, it's very nice view during sunset
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Muralitheran Astacfunk
Review: Remarkable Chinese fine dining in Saujana Hotel. Food were delicious, prepared and presented very well by the chef and staff. I'm trying the charcoal tofu for the first time here, The Sze Chuan soup was marvelous. The fried rice with caviar is special. Will dine again in the future.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Shelley O‚ÄôBrien
Review: Top 3 Chinese restaurant near Klang Valley I think. every foods in the course were great taste and not too much for me. Near by Saujana Resort Hotel lake garden, from outside terrace table the lake view was so wonderful I thought the essence of Asian resort is just here
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Isaac Cheah
Review: Superb service. Manager and staff are tip top. Extremely friendly and capable. Usually quite empty however may have sudden whole restaurant bookings for private functions. Best to call ahead for reservations. Food is excellent though pricey; standard 5 star hotel prices.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Angga Arshavin
Review: Nice place, good food, cozy
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: vidlim
Review: Very good halal dimsumService also impecable
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Emily Lim
Review: Celebrate family‚Äôs reunion here. It has been a yearly affair for us except for the past two years due to MCO. This round, Jeffrey has shown us a pretty warm welcome and the folks love him for that. Will be there more often with him around.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Kuala Lumpur Property
Review: We went here just now to tapau food using our LBS membership discount but they only provide 20% discount for take away instead of 40% for dine in. And couldn't dine in coz it's full.Looking at the menu we are really surprised of the price increased. It's nearly tripple increase compared to previous menu.The manager is also not friendly and not willing to compromise. Not recommendedWe went here just now to tapau food using our LBS membership discount but they only provide 20% discount for take away instead of 40% for dine in. And couldn't dine in coz it's full. ‚Ä¶More
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: KB Tan
Review: Very delicious dim sum, lunch and dinner taste great as well. Just need to bear in mind that quality food comes with a price and hardly you may find a good "non-pork" Chinese restaurant around the town...
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Kid Chan
Review: Nice environment for great Halal dim sum. Price is higher than average, but if you want a nice ambient with great service, this is one of the best. Didn't feel compromised despite being pork-free.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Fan Chein Pang
Review: Delicious food, comfortable environment,  friendly person in charge Mr Jeffrey Wong, a restaurant that worth to come again.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Cindy Wong
Review: Excellent chinese food & dim sum with friendly service . Good view and nice ambience . Great for family . Definitely worth a visit
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Si Howe Lim
Review: With a view of the lake at the Saujana Hotel, food is good and Halal, service par excellence, dim sum served during lunch is great too!
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: yow wk
Review: Nice restaurant. Good food. Friendly staff.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Yee-Min Gan
Review: Surprising excellent for a hotel Chinese restaurant.  Manager was very gracious and gave us complimentary desserts which were very good, not the cut fruits platter but desserts off their menu!
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Erik Lai
Review: The ambience is tranquil. The food and service are amazing. The taste of the dim sum is really exquisite and an experience to be savour with every bite.The excellent service complimented the quality of the food too.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Joey Mitsuhara
Review: Food is not bad and ambience is a plus point.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Chong Chee Fei
Review: Remarkable service, with top notch tasting food.Had dim sum lunch here and most food we had were excellent (siew mai, har gao, fried wu kok, fried carrot cake etc). The fried egg noodles were outstanding but the yang chow fried rice was mediocre.Otherwise, service was attentive and polite which matches the class of the restaurant. Great view facing the small lake and lots of greenery.Only downside was price was on the high side but we'll matches the food quality and service.Remarkable service, with top notch tasting food.Had dim sum lunch here and most food we had were excellent (siew mai, har gao, fried wu kok, fried carrot cake etc). The fried egg noodles were outstanding but ‚Ä¶More
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Regina Rajendran
Review: Great food and service! We always enjoy our meals here.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Mohamad Yawmon
Review: For those who love beautiful scenery and cozy atmosphere, this restaurant is the place to be. Serving Chinese fusion food in its own way. Located within The Saujana Hotel Kuala Lumpur, this restaurant is sure to disappoint you. To those who ask about the halal status of this restaurant, it is pork free.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Manjula Ramalingam
Review: A good place to have group dining. They have both private room seating and open seating. At times booking in advance is advisable especially during weekends. The food tastes good. You can also have special requests and they are very accommodative. The staff is also friendly and helpful.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Lynden Fonseca
Review: Perfect ambiance for a relaxing mood. Well trained staff and great tasting food.
Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: Goh Tian
Review: Have been to this restaurant a few times before for dinner and today first time trying their dim sum. For a 5 star hotel, their dinner menu is always good and delicious.Today's dim sum is freshly prepared and reasonably priced.With nice ambience and good service, have already booked New  Year's Eve and CNY Eve dinner for our next visit.Have been to this restaurant a few times before for dinner and today first time trying their dim sum. For a 5 star hotel, their dinner menu is always good and delicious.Today's dim sum is freshly prepared and reasonably priced. ‚Ä¶More

Review:

Location: Jalan Lapangan Terbang Saas, U 2, Shah Alam, Selangor

Author: GraceC

Author: CA Gonzaga
Review: Had a 10-course dinner. No doubt we're full. Recommending their charcoal bean curd, chicken dumpling, green salad with coconut dressing; also their salted egg-coated shrimp and chicken roll with korean bbq sauce üëå

Author: Karen Lim
Review: To me personally, the food was average and maybe slightly better than average. Not too bad, but not as good as it worth queuing for 2 hours.We reach there at 4pm which is the opening hour and fortunately do not need to queue. Ordered our food and waited for about an hour for the food to be served.The mentis prawn is a bit small but still able to taste it. Lala freshness is just so so on that day. Author: Kok Chuan Wong
Review: Another famous restaurant in Klang but not only for its food. New Boston is also famous for its long wait time. The queue is always there even before they open. Expect one to two hours wait and longer during weekend and public holidays. It is my first visit here and we tried all their signature dishes - steamed lala,  hokkien mee, fried moonlight hor fun, sizzling seafood platter and nestum mantis prawn. Steamed lala was spicy with enough kick, the broth is strong and flavorful. Both hokkien mee and moonlight hor fun was full of "wok hei" and above standard. However, the sizzling seafood platter and nestum prwans was a little disappointing.  The seafood platter sauce was a bit flat, nestum mantis prawn was too sweet. Author: OurSage Memoirs
Review: Probably this reataurant is really into its Lala Soup and not the fried noodles. However, to place the "Hokkein Fried Noodles" as one of its signature, its is hype up.The Hokkein fried noodles really can't make the cut! The crunchy pork lard (must have ingredient) is just not crunchy at all, and in fact its a distraction to the whole dish. The overall taste is sweetish (probably this is what Klang flavour is and i should not impose an opinion on this), but just lack the X-Factor oomph one gets when savouring "Fried Hokkein Noodles". The accompanying sambal is actually a savior for me to finish my noodles, but to opine in the sambal on its own, its just standard. Nothing to shout about. However, at RM7 per pax, its way much cheaper than the famous names like Ah Wa or Damansara Uptown or Sentul Ah Yap.The Tapioca Flour Noodles, which is not listed as favourite, is way better than the Hokkein Fried Noodle. The opinion here is that its way better in comparison to the hokkein mee, but on its own, the verdict is that its ok. Author: K_L T
Review: If you are not from Klang, you will find this restaurant a must-try. Lala, yue kong hor (ÊúàÂÖâÊ≤≥) are must eat. Expect long queue regardless weekdays or weekends. Author: Roveen Cheong
Review: Reached at 5.45pm. Waited around 15 minutes for a table as the restaurant was already full packed. The queue began to steadily build up behind us after we arrived.Sat down and ordered immediately, we ordered everything on their signature list (out of the 2 prawns we chose the mantis prawn)....but to cook 2 plates of noodles, 1 plate of lala, 1 plate of mantis prawns and 1 plate of what they called three kingdoms, took them well over an hour, and they came at different times. We were positively starving so I had to forgo taking pictures at all.. we just dug in.Now on to the food itself, the signature lala was good. They had sufficient ginger, chillies and wine to cover up the seafood smell. The cereal mantis prawn was over fried. So much so that I wouldn't have guessed its mantis prawn of you didn't tell me what I was eating. The hokkien noodle tasted just like any other hokkien noodle from other restaurants. The moonlight noodles were not good and none of us liked it. My mom even thought the noodles were a lil too salty. The three kingdoms, consisted of fish fillets, prawns and cuttlefish, and it didnt feel worth the wait to us. In fact, this was probably the worst out of the 5 dishes. The cuttlefish and prawns were bland and tasteless and only the fish tasted ok. The stench of seafood was overpowering in this dish. They DID NOT do a good job of covering it up.Overall, if you just wanna try the food I'd say you can try it out once, but make sure you have ample time on your hands before you even consider going here. My own verdict is that the food was NOT worth the long wait. The only thing I thought was good was the lala, but, that's just my opinion.Reached at 5.45pm. Waited around 15 minutes for a table as the restaurant was already full packed. The queue began to steadily build up behind us after we arrived. ‚Ä¶More
Location: 1E, Jalan Kapar, Kawasan 18, Klang, Selangor

Author: rovea alcart
Review: Why would u bother to go to this restaurant idk maybe reviews, well heres mine. Here is 5 reasons to not come hereNumber 1. Ridiculously long waiting times for food and u dont get served food together, u have to wait in between dishes while u sit there looking stupid. Number 2. The food is Bad. And i mean BBBAAAADDDD... like everything is a miss. 3 kingdoms dish more like 3 waring kingdoms cause thats the dish a cluster dump. Mantisprawn nestum... Wheres the mantis prawn? Its just fried batter from how overly fried it was burried under a mountain of nestum. Lala? I might as well have a spicy vodka, same taste, less chewing. Noodles plain noodles no actual ingredients in there.Number 3 price, for that food in number 2? No thank you. There are better places to spend that kind of money.Number 4, atmosphere. One way to describe it, Fish Monger Auction Market! It is noisy and very uncomfortable with tables screaming left and right.Number 5, service and inconvenience, the service is bad and very slow, payment methods are inconvenient, they use touch n go pay but they don't have proper electronic system to make payment a smooth transaction. Its a hastle so just bring cash.So overall why would u come here ever? Idk i wouldnt. And for those that hype this place up so much, might want to reconsider those taste buds.Why would u bother to go to this restaurant idk maybe reviews, well heres mine. Quite expected because people say that you have to wait for long time. The clams are really meaty and the soup is quite spicy and you can definitely taste the alcohol taste. There is only small or big - two sizes only. I think small one is enough for two people only if you really like clams. However when we come out there was already a long queue. The restaurant probably going through bad times but if they keep on serving this kind of buffet then it will get worse. Author: Fatin Nabilah
Review: (Translated by Google) Decided to have our iftar here yesterday. Booking was super easy, and the staff picking up our call took extra mile in explaining menus onboard. The main menu is crab, shrimp, fish, chicken and grilled lamb. There are other booths that also serve dishes such as soups, noodles, fruits, and desserts. Lots of choice and delicious. Ambience suitable for family, not too crowded. Surau is provided on the 3rd floor. The staff are all very helpful. Can eat from the start of iftar until 10.30 pm. Parking is paid, but you can stamp a fixed rate of RM10 at the counter. Can repeat again next time.(Original)Decided to have our iftar here yesterday. Booking was super easy, and the staff picking up our call took extra mile in explaining menus onboard. Menu utama adalah ketam, udang, ikan, ayam dan kambing panggang. Terdapat booth2 lain juga yang sediakan masakan seperti sup, mee, buah buahan, dan pencuci mulut. Banyak pilihan dan sedap. Ambience sesuai untuk bawa keluarga, tak terlalu crowded. Surau disediakan di tingkat 3. Staff semua sangat membantu. Boleh makan dari start buka puasa sehingga jam 10.30 malam. Parking berbayar, tapi boleh cop fixed rate RM10 kat kaunter. Boleh repeat lagi next time.(Translated by Google) Decided to have our iftar here yesterday. Booking was super easy, and the staff picking up our call took extra mile in explaining menus onboard.
